summary: This is an email chain from October 2020 discussing the scanning and processing of Epstein case records, referencing prior work in July 2019. It details issues with scanning documents, handling of discs, and mentions the discovery of pornographic images of young girls that were not scanned per protocol. The emails involve coordination between legal and technical staff regarding evidence handling.

events.title: Completion of case records scanning
events.description: Scanning of Epstein case records was completed, with discovery of missing 1As and pornographic images of young girls that were not scanned per protocol.

events.title: Shipment of evidence to FBI New York
events.description: Discs and boxes of Epstein case records were shipped via FedEx to FBI New York.

events.title: Change in discovery work
events.description: Referenced as the date 'our world changed, and we were no longer doing discovery,' likely referring to Epstein's death.

keyFacts: Pornographic images of young girls were found in the Epstein case records and were not scanned per FBI protocols, with placeholder sheets stating 'possible child pornography' DO NOT SCAN.
There were issues with missing documents (1A10, 1A28, 1A84, and serials in 31E-MM-108062) that had to be regenerated from digital copies.
Multiple discs were found scattered throughout the evidence boxes; some were copied but not necessarily processed or extracted for review.
The email chain indicates a shift in work around August 10, 2019, coinciding with Epstein's death, after which discovery efforts halted.
The evidence involved two FBI case files: 72-MM-113327 and 31E-MM-108062.
